page.title: 02Living in Trowbridge 2
page.content: They get good work there. We use computers to draw out some of our money. They also help by counting how much money we have. So you are O.K. working in a bank. Money today consists of copper and silver coins and paper notes. Notes have special watermarks so they cant be forged. This is the money we use 1p, 2p, 5p, 10p, 20p, 50p and Â£1 coin. Â£1, Â£5, Â£10, Â£20, Â£50 are notes. The Â£1 note will not be in use for long because the Â£1 coin is replacing it. If you have a bank account you will also have a cheque book which you can use instead of money. You put money in the Building Societies which gives you more interest than when you put it in the bank. Sometimes you have to use a credit card with a cheque to prove that the cheque book is yours. Autocards can be used.
